Class Library

java.lang.Object
Library
public class Library extends Object
Performs the main LMS functions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Library

      public Library()

  • Method Details

    • addBook

      public void addBook(String barcode, String title, String volume, String author)
      Adds a book to the database from a file.
      Parameters:
      barcode - The barcode of the book.
      title - The title of the book.
      volume - The volume of the book.
      author - The author of the book.

    • removeBook

      public void removeBook(int barcode) throws IOException, SQLException
      Removes a book from the database using the book's barcode as reference.
      Parameters:
      barcode - The barcode of the book.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
      SQLException - If a SQL error occurs.

    • removeBook

      public void removeBook(String title) throws IOException
      Removes a book from the database that has the inputted title. If there are multiple books with the same title, prompts the user to select the specific book to be deleted.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the book.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • openFile

      public void openFile() throws IOException
      Opens and reads the chosen file from the FileChooser. If the file contains valid books, sends the books' information to addBook() so that they can be added to the collection.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • manageBook

      public void manageBook(String title, String either) throws IOException, SQLException
      Sends the book to be either checked in or out. If more than one book is found, the multipleBooks() method is called. If only one book is found, the singleBook() method is called.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the book.
      either - Either "in" or "out" as a String.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
      SQLException - If a SQL error occurs.

    • multipleBooks

      public void multipleBooks(String either, ArrayList<Book> tempBookList, LocalDate date, Boolean delete, String searchTitle) throws IOException
      If the searchCollection() method finds multiple books, this method is called. It changes the availability and due date of the book according to whether it is being checked in or out. If delete is true, it deletes the book instead of checking it in/out.
      Parameters:
      either - Either "in" or "out" as a String.
      tempBookList - An ArrayList containing Book objects.
      date - The LocalDate representing the due date for checking out a book (null for checking in).
      delete - A Boolean indicating whether to delete the book.
      searchTitle - The title of the book to be modified or deleted.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • singleBook

      public void singleBook(String title, String either, LocalDate date) throws IOException
      If the searchCollection method only finds one book, this method is called. It changes the availability and due date of the book according to whether it is being checked in or out.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the book to be modified.
      either - Either "in" or "out" as a String.
      date - The LocalDate representing the due date for checking out a book (null for checking in).
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • searchCollection

      public int searchCollection(String title, String either) throws SQLException
      Queries the database to see if there are multiple books with the same name and availability status. Returns the number of books that meet the criteria.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the book to be searched.
      either - Either "in" or "out" as a String.
      Returns:
      The count of books that meet the search criteria.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a SQL error occurs.

    • successAlert

      public void successAlert(String message) throws IOException
      Calls the createAndShowAlert method to create a success alert using the message parameter.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be displayed in the alert.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • errorAlert

      public void errorAlert(String message) throws IOException
      Calls the createAndShowAlert method to create an error alert using the message parameter.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be displayed in the alert.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.
